name: Egg White Bites
author: Kim
summary: My husband actually calls these 'mini egg white pizzas,' because they puff up a lot in the oven, then deflate while cooling--and end up looking like little pizzas! No matter what you call them, they taste pretty good, and make for an easy grab-and-go snack! Extras may be frozen, and reheated before serving.
ingredients: 1 cup finely chopped red bell pepper
½ cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Generously grease a 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray
Combine egg whites, Greek yogurt, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, and cayenne in a bowl; whisk until smooth and no lumps remain
Mix in red bell pepper, spinach, and Cheddar cheese
Divide egg mixture between the 12 muffin cups, filling until almost full
Bake in the preheated oven until egg bites puff up substantially and begin to brown, 20 to 25 minutes
Allow to cool for 5 minutes; bites will deflate substantially at this time
Run a knife around the edges and bottoms to loosen and remove from the cups
Allow to cool to room temperature
